meanings.definition: The quality or state of having spatial characteristics.
meanings.sent1: The spatiality of the room was evident in its size and layout.
meanings.sent2: The map displayed the spatiality of the city with clear boundaries.
meanings.sent3: The spatiality of the puzzle made it challenging to fit the pieces together.
meanings.sent4: Her artwork beautifully captured the spatiality of nature's vastness.
meanings.sent5: The spatiality of the garden allowed for various planting options.

meanings.definition: The extent or amount of space occupied by something.
meanings.sent1: The spatiality of the box was perfect for storing books.
meanings.sent2: The spatiality of the parking lot determined its capacity for cars.
meanings.sent3: The spatiality of the cake surprised everyone with its large size.
meanings.sent4: The spatiality of the closet seemed to expand magically to fit more clothes.
meanings.sent5: The spatiality of the field accommodated many players during the game.

meanings.definition: The relationship between objects in physical space.
meanings.sent1: The spatiality of the furniture arrangement created a cozy atmosphere.
meanings.sent2: The architect considered the spatiality of the building to enhance flow.
meanings.sent3: The spatiality of the dance performance showcased graceful movements.
meanings.sent4: The spatiality of the city's layout influenced traffic patterns.
meanings.sent5: The spatiality of the sculpture interacted with the surrounding environment.
